# The `BinaryStreamWriter` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Provides write only access to a subclass of <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/writablebinarystream">WritableBinaryStream</a></code>. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::BinaryStreamWriter</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

Provides write only access to a subclass of <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/writablebinarystream">WritableBinaryStream</a></code>.

Provides bounds checking and helpers for writing certain common data types such as null-terminated strings, integers in various flavors of endianness, etc. Can be subclassed to provide reading and writing of custom datatypes, although no methods are overridable.

Definition at line 30 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamwriter-h">BinaryStreamWriter.h</a>.

### writeArray() {#a1e5febb5c471f88c785519a211871b01}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename T&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>Error llvm::BinaryStreamWriter::writeArray (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; T &gt; Array)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Writes an array of objects of type T to the underlying stream, as if by using memcpy.

It is up to the caller to ensure that type of <code>Obj</code> can be safely copied in this fashion, as no checks are made to ensure that this is safe.


<SectionUser title="Returns">
a success error code if the data was successfully written, otherwise returns an appropriate error code.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamwriter-h/#l00144">144</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamwriter-h">BinaryStreamWriter.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### writeBytes() {#abb614d7e749a1af26c1d719b28ba4fb7}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Error BinaryStreamWriter::writeBytes (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; uint8&#95;t &gt; Buffer)</>}>
Write the bytes specified in <code>Buffer</code> to the underlying stream.

On success, updates the offset so that subsequent writes will occur at the next unwritten position.


<SectionUser title="Returns">
a success error code if the data was successfully written, otherwise returns an appropriate error code.
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamwriter-h/#l00050">50</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamwriter-h">BinaryStreamWriter.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/binarystreamwriter-cpp/#l00028">28</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/binarystreamwriter-cpp">BinaryStreamWriter.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### writeCString() {#a07608f1ac2a8045b1b72108b840a8ca3}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Error BinaryStreamWriter::writeCString (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Str)</>}>
Write the string <code>Str</code> to the underlying stream followed by a null terminator.

On success, updates the offset so that subsequent writes occur at the next unwritten position. <code>Str</code> need not be null terminated on input.


<SectionUser title="Returns">
a success error code if the data was successfully written, otherwise returns an appropriate error code.
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamwriter-h/#l00096">96</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamwriter-h">BinaryStreamWriter.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/binarystreamwriter-cpp/#l00047">47</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/binarystreamwriter-cpp">BinaryStreamWriter.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### writeFixedString() {#ac9c2dc641243ad8170ac9c0e69545f37}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Error BinaryStreamWriter::writeFixedString (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Str)</>}>
Write the string <code>Str</code> to the underlying stream without a null terminator.

On success, updates the offset so that subsequent writes occur at the next unwritten position.


<SectionUser title="Returns">
a success error code if the data was successfully written, otherwise returns an appropriate error code.
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamwriter-h/#l00104">104</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamwriter-h">BinaryStreamWriter.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/binarystreamwriter-cpp/#l00056">56</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/binarystreamwriter-cpp">BinaryStreamWriter.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### writeInteger() {#a344647bc1c4a4b53334296eba145d408}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename T&gt;</>}
  prototype="Error llvm::BinaryStreamWriter::writeInteger (T Value)"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Write the integer <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a></code> to the underlying stream in the specified endianness.

On success, updates the offset so that subsequent writes occur at the next unwritten position.


<SectionUser title="Returns">
a success error code if the data was successfully written, otherwise returns an appropriate error code.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamwriter-h/#l00058">58</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamwriter-h">BinaryStreamWriter.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### writeObject() {#ae73ad246f9f1adc35f0ce49fc089b52a}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename T&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>Error llvm::BinaryStreamWriter::writeObject (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> T &amp; Obj)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Writes the object <code>Obj</code> to the underlying stream, as if by using memcpy.

It is up to the caller to ensure that type of <code>Obj</code> can be safely copied in this fashion, as no checks are made to ensure that this is safe.


<SectionUser title="Returns">
a success error code if the data was successfully written, otherwise returns an appropriate error code.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamwriter-h/#l00128">128</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamwriter-h">BinaryStreamWriter.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### writeStreamRef() {#aa08601ded5ad31dbdd5a5262a972f479}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Error BinaryStreamWriter::writeStreamRef (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystreamref">BinaryStreamRef</a> Ref)</>}>
Efficiently reads all data from <code>Ref</code>, and writes it to this stream.

This operation will not invoke any copies of the source data, regardless of the source stream&#39;s implementation.


<SectionUser title="Returns">
a success error code if the data was successfully written, otherwise returns an appropriate error code.
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamwriter-h/#l00112">112</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystreamwriter-h">BinaryStreamWriter.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/binarystreamwriter-cpp/#l00061">61</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/binarystreamwriter-cpp">BinaryStreamWriter.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### writeStreamRef() {#a5e81cda2da9491cb31a8896967aafdfc}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Error BinaryStreamWriter::writeStreamRef (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystreamref">BinaryStreamRef</a> Ref, uint64&#95;t Size)</>}>
Efficiently reads <code>Size</code> bytes from <code>Ref</code>, and writes it to this stream.

This operation will not invoke any copies of the source data, regardless of the source stream&#39;s implementation.


<SectionUser title="Returns">
a success error code if the data was successfully written, otherwise returns an appropriate error code.
</SectionUser>
